Title: Software Engineer (Data), Business Tech Solutions
RoleDescription:
Snapshot
Are you an experienced Software Engineer ready to make a significant contribution, developing the data foundations and AI-powered solutions that will transform how our organization operates and innovates?
Join Google DeepMind's Business Tech Solutions team! In this role, you will collaborate closely with our Core Analytics team, focusing your expertise on three crucial areas. Firstly, you'll own and evolve their infrastructure with an emphasis on reliability, developing custom tooling to enhance efficiency and scalability. Secondly, you'll tackle deep data engineering challenges, building and optimizing critical pipelines and foundational data systems. Finally, you'll lead the creation of new data-adjacent tools and systems, incorporating AI to innovate and empower our internal operations.
This is a unique opportunity to combine deep technical expertise in software/data engineering with the practical application of AI, directly contributing to how our teams operate and make data-driven decisions.
About us
Google DeepMind: Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanitys most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, were a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.
Business Tech Solutions (BTS): BTS is a key team within Google DeepMinds broader Technical Operations & Analytics (TO&A) group  dedicated to building robust systems, processes, and technology that support data-led decisions and power GDM operations at scale. As part of this mission, BTS designs, develops, and manages critical technology platforms that significantly enhance internal productivity and effectiveness. This role will collaborate deeply with Core Analytics  TO&As data analytics team  to drive the infrastructure behind organising, modeling, and deploying data to guide Google DeepMind's strategy and decisions.
The role
We are looking for a seasoned Software Engineer who excels at designing, building, and maintaining robust, scalable systems, with some experience in data engineering. You should thrive on tackling complex technical challenges and translating internal needs into effective, efficient solutions. This role offers a unique opportunity to work across critical internal functions  from supporting analytics capabilities with solid data infrastructure to streamlining operations with AI based tooling  directly impacting how the organisation functions and innovates. This involves designing and implementing scalable data pipelines and infrastructure, developing and iterating on practical AI-driven tools for internal processes, and collaborating closely with stakeholders such as analytics teams and operational groups.
Key responsibilities

Deep Data Engineering & Foundational Systems: Design, develop, deploy, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines and critical foundational data systems.
SRE for Core Analytics Infrastructure & Tooling: Proactively ensure optimal performance, reliability, and scalability of data infrastructure.
Full-Stack Tool & AI Solution Development: Lead the design, build, and refinement of new data-adjacent tools and AI based systems.
Cross-functional Collaboration & Partnership: Work effectively and collaboratively with engineers, data analysts, project managers, and other stakeholders across different teams.
Technical Leadership & Team Growth: Champion high engineering standards, contribute to the team's technical strategy and actively participate in knowledge sharing.

About you
We're looking for a highly experienced and impactful Software Engineer with the following skills and experience:

Extensive Software Engineering Experience: Proven track record (typically 3+ years) in professional software engineering roles, demonstrating experience in designing, building, and maintaining complex systems, data infrastructure, or internal tools.
Complex Problem Solving & System Design: Demonstrated ability to analyze ambiguous requirements, break down complex technical or operational problems, and design robust, scalable, and maintainable system architectures.
Database Proficiency: Strong understanding of and practical experience with relational databases (SQL), including schema design, query optimization, and data modeling. Familiarity with NoSQL databases is beneficial.
Data Pipeline & Infrastructure Experience: Demonstrated ability in designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines and the underlying infrastructure. Experience with relevant frameworks and technologies is key, for example, working with distributed processing systems like Apache Beam or Flume, and orchestrating SQL pipelines and workflows using tools such as Apache Airflow or Luigi.
Full-Stack Development Proficiency: Experience developing both frontend (e.g., using JavaScript frameworks like React/Angular, HTML, CSS) and backend (e.g. Python, Java, Go) components for web applications.
Effective Communication & Collaboration: Ability to clearly articulate technical designs, trade-offs, and decisions to diverse audiences (technical and non-technical). Proven ability to collaborate effectively within and across engineering and stakeholder teams.

In addition, the following would be an advantage: 

Experience Developing AI-Driven Tools: Experience designing and building practical tools or applications that leverage AI technologies to solve specific business problems or automate tasks.
Technical Project Leadership: Experience formally or informally leading technical projects or complex workstreams, demonstrating capabilities in planning, execution, and managing technical risks.
Advanced Mentorship & Coaching: Demonstrated experience actively mentoring or coaching other engineers, making significant contributions to their technical development and growth.

What we can offer you:

Direct Impact on Internal Operations: Directly influence how internal teams work by designing, building, and improving the critical tools, infrastructure, and automated processes they rely on daily, translating your engineering efforts into tangible efficiency gains.
Exposure to Diverse Technical Challenges: Tackle a wide variety of intellectually stimulating engineering problems across different internal domains  from scalable data infrastructure and AI-driven tooling to full-stack applications that enhance productivity.
Opportunity for Technical Innovation & Ownership: Drive the adoption of new technologies and engineering approaches within the team. Take ownership of key internal systems with the autonomy to propose and implement innovative solutions.
Visibility with Key Internal Stakeholders: Partner directly with leads and stakeholders within analytics, operations, People and Culture, and other key internal functions, shaping the technical solutions they depend on and influencing technical direction within these areas.
Collaborative & Supportive Engineering Environment: Be part of a skilled and supportive engineering team focused on delivering internal impact. Benefit from collaborative problem-solving, knowledge sharing, and a culture that values technical excellence and pragmatic solutions.

Title: Research Scientist, LLM, Science
RoleDescription:
Snapshot
Our special interdisciplinary team combines the best techniques from deep learning, reinforcement learning and systems neuroscience to build general-purpose learning algorithms. We have already made a number of high profile breakthroughs towards building artificial general intelligence, and we have all the ingredients in place to make further significant progress over the coming years.
About Us
Were a dedicated scientific community, committed to solving intelligence and ensuring our technology is used for widespread public benefit. 
Weve built a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged and learning is shared freely. We dont set limits based on what others think is possible or impossible. We drive ourselves and inspire each other to push boundaries and achieve ambitious goals.
The Role
To succeed in this role you will need to be passionate about advancing science using recent breakthroughs in large language models, in addition to standard machine learning and other computational techniques. You will join an interdisciplinary team of domain experts, ML researchers and engineers exploring a diverse set of important scientific problems in biology, physics, mathematics and other areas. Our work is organised into several longer-term focus areas which aim to achieve step changes to the state-of-the-art (as exemplified in e.g. AlphaFold, AlphaMissense and FunSearch). You'll leverage our unique mix of expertise, data and computational resources to experiment and iterate both rapidly and at scale.
As a Research Scientist in Science, you will use your machine learning expertise to collaborate with domain experts and machine learning scientists to develop and run experiments exploring new applications of AI - particularly LLMs - to science problems. The team is pioneering in many different domains so you may take part in exploratory work validating early ideas or work in a maturing area to deepen and exploit a promising line of research. You may also contribute to the scientific knowledge and experience of the team with your own scientific domain knowledge. You will work with internal and external researchers on pioneering research bridging AI and science.
Key responsibilities:

Research the development and application of natural language LLMs for scientific problems.
Plan and perform rapid prototyping of large language model techniques applied to problems in science.
Engage with both underlying data sources (including diverse scientific text, figures, and multimodal data) and models.
Undertake exploratory analysis to inform experimentation and research directions.
Collaborate with researchers and machine learning engineers to identify and develop novel large language model approaches tailored to natural sciences.
Report and present research findings and developments (including status and results) clearly and efficiently both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet research goals for the wider science program.

The role will suit candidates who enjoy working in a heavily experimental setting with large and noisy datasets and who wish to immerse themselves in innovative science, LLM, ML and AI research.
About You
In order to set you up for success as a Research Scientist at Google DeepMind,  we look for the following skills and experience:

PhD degree or equivalent experience in computer science, electrical engineering, natural science, or mathematics.
Experience working with large language models (LLMs), e.g. fine-tuning and inference.
Experience working with large and noisy datasets.
Experience with at least one programming language (with a preference for those commonly used in machine learning or scientific computing such as Python or C++).
Knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics equivalent to at least first-year university coursework.
Experience exploring, analysing and visualising data.
Experience using Jax, PyTorch, NumPy, Pandas or similar ML/scientific libraries.

In addition, the following would be an advantage: 

Experience with advanced recent LLM techniques.
Scientific domain knowledge (particularly biology, physics, or chemistry).

When assessing technical background we will take a holistic view of the mix of scientific, ML and computational experience. We do not expect you to be an expert in all fields simultaneously. However, except for scientific knowledge, since the role serves as a bridge between all three, some experience in each is necessary.

At Google DeepMind, youll have the opportunity to revolutionise AI by applying state-of-the-art AI to Chip Design. We develop research breakthroughs that impact Google's products and services. We will be enabling the most advanced AI models running on the most advanced chips.

We develop and apply state-of-the-art AI methods and models to Chip Design and work closely with research and product teams across Google.

Bring the most advanced ML models and technologies to Chip Design. 
Develop breakthroughs that will have a big impact for Google and for the whole Chip design industry.
Use LLMs and transformer models to accelerate chip design.
Solve some of the most complex tasks in Chip Design (RTL generation, RTL verification, Logic Synthesis, Physical Design, PPA prediction, ...).

Contribute and drive ML for Physical Design, Logical Synthesis, Verification and RTL generation.
